column5: Alarm: Communications error exists in the outstation
Alarm: One or More P1 Alarms Active
Alarm: One or More P2 Alarms Active
Alarm: One or More P3 Alarms Active

column2: Storage State of Charge at Maximum.  Maximum Usable State of Charge reached.
Storage State of Charge is Too High.  Maximum Reserve Percentage (of usable capacity) reached.
Storage State of Charge is Too Low. Minimum Reserve Percentage (of usable capacity) reached.
Storage State of Charge is Depleted. Minimum Usable State of Charge Reached.
Storage Internal Temperature is Too High
Storage External (Ambient) Temperature is Too High

System Is In Local State.  System has been locked by a local operator which prevents other operators from executing commands. Note: Local State is also sometimes referred to as Maintenance State. Local State overrides Lockout State.
System Is In Lockout State.  System has been locked by an operator such that other operators may not execute commands. Lockout State is also sometimes referred to as Blocked State
System Is Starting Up. Set to 1 when a BO "System Initiate Start-up Sequence" command has been received.
System Is Stopping Set to 1 when BO "System Execute Stop" command has been received.
column5: Emergency stop command has been received.

column2: System is Started (Return to Service). If any of the DER Units are started then true. DER Units in the maintenance operational state are excluded.
System is Stopped (Cease to Energize). If all of the DER Units are stopped then true. DER Units in the maintenance operational state are excluded.
DER is Off but Available to Start
DER is Off and Not Available to Start

Islanded Mode. Determines how the DER behaves when in an Islanded configuration. <0>  Isochronous Mode. DER attempts to control voltage and frequency independent of configured curves and settings up to the limits of the machine's capabilities in order to achieve the AO Reference Voltage and AO nominal frequency. <1> Droop Mode.  DER acts as a follower using Volt/VAR and Freq/Watt curves.

Sensed Grid Config Detection Enabled.  If Enabled the DER may independently change its Active Settings Group based on locally observed grid conditions. <0> No Autonomous Detection. <1> Autonomous Detection.  Inverter's Active Settings Group may differ from the Requested Settings Group
Storage Capacity Units.  Determines whether energy storage values are expressed in units of Amp-hrs or Watt-hrs.
Time Constant Mode. Indicates whether Time Constant Ramp parameters are interpreted as Open Loop Response times or 3Tau values.
Power Factor Excitation When Discharging / Generating
Supports Dynamic Reactive Current Support Mode
Operating Mode - Dynamic Reactive Current Support Enabled
Operating Mode - Active Power Limit Enabled
Operating Mode - Coordinated Charge / Discharge Management Enabled
Operating Mode - Active Power Response Mode #1 Enabled
Operating Mode - Active Power Response Mode #2 Enabled
Operating Mode - Active Power Response Mode #3 Enabled
Operating Mode - Automatic Generation Control Enabled
Operating Mode - Active Power Smoothing Enabled
Operating Mode - Fixed Power Factor Enabled
Operating Mode - Volt- VAR Control Enabled
Operating Mode - Power Factor Correction Enabled
Operating Mode - Event-Based Reactive Current Support Enabled
Frequency-Watt Curve Mode - Snapshot of Power
Charge/Discharge Mode - Use Ramp Rates. Indicates whether or not Charge/Discharge should use specified ramp rates or time constants
AGC Mode - Use Ramp Rates. Indicates whether or not charge/discharge should use specified ramp rates or time constants
Volt-Watt - Use Ramp Rates and Time Constants
column5: Use Ramp Rates AND Time Constants
